text: we're here today at hungry which is a
very new style almost not even a Chinese
noodle shop however they're fortunate to
have master Chen who is a master noodle
puller he performed an apprenticeship
for more than a month and has learned
the traditional way of developing the
gluten of pulling the noodles and these
are called la mean we're starting with
the flour this is a water that has a
solution in it that includes some of
what is called punked way which is an
alkaline that helps make noodles spring
after master Chen had completed his
internship he stayed at the restaurant
in mono for more than two months
learning how to work the dough
especially in different climates
humidity is very important a kind of
flower is very important Master Chen has
said that this is relatively a difficult
flower to work with organic flour tends
to be more hard in that it has more
wheat gluten and as you can see it
requires almost a full body kneading
banging the dough against the surface
and also meaning it very very strongly
as part of the way that the gluten
fibers are developed which is what makes
the dough have such a springy texture
the twisting process is the beginning of
the development of the noodles which
actually exists inside the twists of
dough and it's almost as if he separates
them with his fingers
now master Chen will begin to form the
actual noodles that become the noodles
that are in your suit most people only
see it from this part they can be made
thick or thin the important thing is
that they have something that we call
Jia jiggle which is stretchiness the
literal translation is to power and
that's what we hope to have in the
finished noodles hungry opened in
October of 2010 and one of the things
that has made it so special ever since
is the broths that chef Michael Hodgkin
has built around these noodles in
addition to a broth that includes
roasted ginger the dish has three
different kinds of squash Long Island
cheese butter nut and Kubota originally
a Japanese and boss this is a totally
untraditional broth usually in Chinese
noodle shops there is not a vegetarian
option but this is one of the really
most interesting ones at hungry part of
the reason that we like it here so much
